q1.question: Please input the case number / name

q3.question: Arrest date (or record date from OSBI report)

q4.question: Additional record or arrest dates associated with this case?

q6.question:
Was the case resolved by any of 
Acquittal
Reversed on appeal, dismissed by DA
Dismissed on appeal
DNA dismissal 
Full pardon by governor 
Under 18, full pardon
Identity theft

q7.question: Did this case resulted in conviction, dismissal, deferred judgment expired/dismissed, dismissed on completion of drug court
options: Dismissed on completion of drug court

q8.question: Have all treatment programs been completed?

q9.question: Date that the deferred sentence expired, that probation (including unsupervised probation) was completed, or that the person left incarceration, whichever is latest

q10.question: Have all fines, fees, and restitution been paid?

q11.question:
Do any of the following apply? 
SOL Expired 
DA has confirmed in writing they will not refile 
Case dismissed with costs, and costs paid or waived
q11.note: Generally, the statute of limitations under <22 O.S. ยง 152> is three years, or another period specified in ยง 152. However some crimes have separate limitations periods found elsewhere in the Oklahoma Statutes.
